rrricanes in Data World

Tim Trice

June 15, 2017

Methods of loading storm data in rrricanes includes parsing the National Hurricane Center archives which can be time-consuming and unreliable (consistent timeout issues). The function load_storm_data returns post-scraped datasets from the rrricanesdata and is much faster. However, you have to load the entire dataset and this may not be convenient for some users.

A third option is data.world which is automatically updated from the rrricanesdata repository. The benefit of data.world is that you can custom build queries to extract only the data you need.

Using data.world requires the dwapi package which can be installed from CRAN.

install.packages("dwapi")

You will also need to get your API key in order to access the datasets. See the “quickstart” vignette for help using dwapi.

vignette("quickstart", package = "dwapi")

This article will focus on building SQL queries to retrieve data from data.world. There are some limitations to the functionality. See SQL on data.world for more information.

library(dplyr)
library(dwapi)
library(rrricanes)

Configure dwapi to use your own API key. Then set the ds parameter to the rrricanes dataset at “timtrice/rrricanes”.

configure(auth_token = Sys.getenv("dwapi_visitor_key"))
ds <- "timtrice/rrricanes"

storms

The storms dataframe is a summary table of all storms that exist in the dataset.

ds %>% sql(query = "SELECT * FROM storms LIMIT 5")
## # A tibble: 5 x 5
##        key   name  wind           startdate             enddate
##      <chr>  <chr> <int>              <dttm>              <dttm>
## 1 AL011998   Alex    45 1998-07-27 15:00:00 1998-08-02 21:00:00
## 2 AL011999 Arlene    50 1999-06-11 21:00:00 1999-06-18 03:00:00
## 3 AL012008 Arthur    35 2008-05-31 17:00:00 2008-06-02 03:00:00
## 4 AL062002    Fay    50 2002-09-05 21:00:00 2002-09-07 15:00:00
## 5 AL062003    Six    30 2003-07-19 21:00:00 2003-07-21 21:00:00

Find a storm by name

ds %>% sql(query = "SELECT * FROM storms WHERE Name = 'Katrina'")
## # A tibble: 2 x 5
##        key    name  wind           startdate             enddate
##      <chr>   <chr> <int>              <dttm>              <dttm>
## 1 AL122005 Katrina   150 2005-08-23 21:00:00 2005-08-30 15:00:00
## 2 AL151999 Katrina    35 1999-10-28 21:00:00 1999-11-01 21:00:00

Aggregate storms by month

ds %>% sql(query = "SELECT COUNT(Key) AS `n`,
        MONTH(CAST(storms.StartDate AS STRING)) AS `Mth`
    FROM `storms`
    GROUP BY MONTH(CAST(storms.StartDate AS STRING))
    ORDER BY `Mth`;")
## # A tibble: 10 x 2
##        n   Mth
##    <int> <chr>
##  1     1    01
##  2     2    04
##  3    27    05
##  4    54    06
##  5   105    07
##  6   163    08
##  7   159    09
##  8   103    10
##  9    26    11
## 10     4    12

adv

The adv dataframe lists the core data of every advisory for every storm. This excludes forecast points and all wind radii.

ds %>% sql(query = "SELECT * FROM adv LIMIT 5")
## # A tibble: 5 x 19
##        key   adv                date              status     name   lat
##      <chr> <int>              <dttm>               <chr>    <chr> <dbl>
## 1 AL011998     1 1998-07-27 15:00:00 Tropical Depression      One  11.5
## 2 AL011998     2 1998-07-27 21:00:00 Tropical Depression      One  12.2
## 3 AL011998    11 1998-07-30 03:00:00      Tropical Storm     Alex  14.3
## 4 AL041998    24 1998-08-30 09:00:00           Hurricane Danielle  26.7
## 5 AL132000     1 2000-09-21 15:00:00 Tropical Depression Thirteen  11.7
## # ... with 13 more variables: lon <dbl>, wind <int>, gust <int>,
## #   pressure <int>, posacc <int>, fwddir <int>, fwdspeed <int>, eye <int>,
## #   seasne <int>, seasse <int>, seassw <int>, seasnw <int>, location <chr>

Earlier we saw there were two storms named Katrina. Let’s build a query and return all the adv observations we have for Katrina (Key “AL122005”).

ds %>% sql(query = 
"SELECT * 
FROM adv
WHERE Key = 'AL122005';")
## # A tibble: 31 x 19
##         key   adv                date              status    name   lat
##       <chr> <int>              <dttm>               <chr>   <chr> <dbl>
##  1 AL122005     1 2005-08-23 21:00:00 Tropical Depression  Twelve  23.2
##  2 AL122005     2 2005-08-24 03:00:00 Tropical Depression  Twelve  23.4
##  3 AL122005     3 2005-08-24 09:00:00 Tropical Depression  Twelve  24.0
##  4 AL122005     4 2005-08-24 15:00:00      Tropical Storm Katrina  24.7
##  5 AL122005     5 2005-08-24 21:00:00      Tropical Storm Katrina  25.6
##  6 AL122005     6 2005-08-25 03:00:00      Tropical Storm Katrina  26.0
##  7 AL122005     7 2005-08-25 09:00:00      Tropical Storm Katrina  26.2
##  8 AL122005     8 2005-08-25 15:00:00      Tropical Storm Katrina  26.2
##  9 AL122005     9 2005-08-25 21:00:00           Hurricane Katrina  26.1
## 10 AL122005    10 2005-08-26 03:00:00           Hurricane Katrina  25.5
## # ... with 21 more rows, and 13 more variables: lon <dbl>, wind <int>,
## #   gust <int>, pressure <int>, posacc <int>, fwddir <int>,
## #   fwdspeed <int>, eye <int>, seasne <int>, seasse <int>, seassw <int>,
## #   seasnw <int>, location <chr>

wr

ds %>% sql(query = "SELECT * FROM wr LIMIT 5")
## # A tibble: 5 x 8
##        key   adv                date windfield    ne    se    sw    nw
##      <chr> <int>              <dttm>     <int> <int> <int> <int> <int>
## 1 AL011998     7 1998-07-29 03:00:00        34   100    50    50   100
## 2 AL011998     8 1998-07-29 09:00:00        34   100    50    50   100
## 3 AL011998    17 1998-07-31 15:00:00        34   125    25    25   125
## 4 AL012004    17 2004-08-04 15:00:00        50    40    75    50    50
## 5 AL032004    21 2004-08-14 09:00:00        50    50    75    30    25
ds %>% sql(query = 
"SELECT * 
FROM wr
WHERE Key = 'AL122005';")
## # A tibble: 69 x 8
##         key   adv                date windfield    ne    se    sw    nw
##       <chr> <int>              <dttm>     <int> <int> <int> <int> <int>

##  3 AL122005     6 2005-08-25 03:00:00        34    60    60     0     0

##  5 AL122005     8 2005-08-25 15:00:00        34    60    60    30    50
##  6 AL122005     8 2005-08-25 15:00:00        50    20    20     0     0
##  7 AL122005     9 2005-08-25 21:00:00        34    70    70    50    60

##  9 AL122005     9 2005-08-25 21:00:00        64    15    15    10    10

fcst

ds %>% sql(query = "SELECT * FROM fcst LIMIT 5")
## # A tibble: 5 x 9
##        key   adv                date            fcstdate   lat   lon  wind
##      <chr> <int>              <dttm>              <dttm> <dbl> <dbl> <int>
## 1 AL011998     1 1998-07-27 15:00:00 1998-07-28 00:00:00  12.0 -29.9    30
## 2 AL011998     1 1998-07-27 15:00:00 1998-07-28 12:00:00  12.8 -33.9    35
## 3 AL011998     3 1998-07-28 03:00:00 1998-07-28 12:00:00  12.9 -32.2    30
## 4 AL011998    21 1998-08-01 15:00:00 1998-08-02 00:00:00  18.0 -57.2    35
## 5 AL012013     5 2013-06-06 21:00:00 2013-06-08 06:00:00  39.8 -73.3    40
## # ... with 2 more variables: gust <int>, location <chr>
ds %>% sql(query = 
"SELECT * 
FROM fcst
WHERE Key = 'AL122005';")
## # A tibble: 183 x 9
##         key   adv                date            fcstdate   lat   lon
##       <chr> <int>              <dttm>              <dttm> <dbl> <dbl>
##  1 AL122005     1 2005-08-23 21:00:00 2005-08-24 06:00:00  24.0 -76.5
##  2 AL122005     1 2005-08-23 21:00:00 2005-08-24 18:00:00  25.0 -77.7
##  3 AL122005     1 2005-08-23 21:00:00 2005-08-25 06:00:00  25.7 -78.5
##  4 AL122005     1 2005-08-23 21:00:00 2005-08-25 18:00:00  26.0 -79.4
##  5 AL122005     1 2005-08-23 21:00:00 2005-08-26 18:00:00  26.3 -81.0
##  6 AL122005     1 2005-08-23 21:00:00 2005-08-27 18:00:00  26.5 -83.5
##  7 AL122005     2 2005-08-24 03:00:00 2005-08-24 12:00:00  24.2 -76.7
##  8 AL122005     2 2005-08-24 03:00:00 2005-08-25 00:00:00  25.1 -77.7
##  9 AL122005     2 2005-08-24 03:00:00 2005-08-25 12:00:00  25.7 -78.5
## 10 AL122005     2 2005-08-24 03:00:00 2005-08-26 00:00:00  26.1 -79.5
## # ... with 173 more rows, and 3 more variables: wind <int>, gust <int>,
## #   location <chr>

fcst_wr

ds %>% sql(query = "SELECT * FROM fcst_wr LIMIT 5")
## # A tibble: 5 x 9
##        key   adv                date            fcstdate windfield    ne
##      <chr> <int>              <dttm>              <dttm>     <int> <int>

## 2 AL011998     1 1998-07-27 15:00:00 1998-07-29 00:00:00        34   100
## 3 AL011998     4 1998-07-28 09:00:00 1998-07-29 18:00:00        34   100

## 5 AL012013    10 2013-06-08 03:00:00 2013-06-09 12:00:00        34   210

FROM fcst_wr
WHERE Key = 'AL122005';")

wndprb

ds %>% sql(query = "SELECT * FROM wndprb LIMIT 5")
## # A tibble: 5 x 18

FROM wndprb

prblty

ds %>% sql(query = "SELECT * FROM prblty LIMIT 5")
## # A tibble: 5 x 10
##           status   name   adv                date      location     a
##            <chr>  <chr> <int>              <dttm>         <chr> <int>
## 1 Tropical Storm   Alex     7 1998-07-29 03:00:00  15.0N  43.4W    43
## 2 Tropical Storm   Alex     7 1998-07-29 03:00:00  16.8N  48.2W     0
## 3 Tropical Storm   Alex     9 1998-07-29 15:00:00  16.5N  52.0W     0
## 4 Tropical Storm   Alex    14 1998-07-30 21:00:00  ST THOMAS VI     0
## 5      Hurricane Bonnie    27 1998-08-25 21:00:00 ILE ST PIERRE     0
## # ... with 4 more variables: b <int>, c <int>, d <int>, e <int>

There was no Key value in strike probabilities. Therefore, must use a combination of Status, Name and, if necessary, Adv and Date.
